history.text: This is actually one of my favorite movies, its a shame that kevin mccalister turned to drugs and ruined his acting career.
A film's success can hurt an actor's career if their last film get more attention then there last. Do you think Home Alone would be a classic if it was released today?
I believe it would get the same response as it did in 1990, Do you think the film would have as much success if they replaced kevin mcclaster ?
Maybe. If it was a girl who had the same personality as Kevin. Yes.The timing is right as more female leads are coming out in films.
do you agree with the rating of this movie? 5.5/10? or do you think it should be higher or lower

I think those ratings are based on current critics. It would be interest to see if they were based on critic scores from 1990. I felt the score is fine. The film was a fun adventure with little depth to it.
I agree, it would be cool to see a remake to this movie.
or a all grown up version of it.
i even like your opinion about a female character, would be cool to see a remake with a girl instead.
I think a grown up version would be interesting. Do you think a remake could be as tamed at the 1990 version? No sexual humor.
Today's remakes don't have that charm that made the originals magical.
you must be a old soul like me, i love older movies.
haa the paragraph says adult bashing, this society is so uptight.
Yeah. But the film is about a 8 year-old boy who gets left behind because his parents forget about him. They where so focused on the holiday vacation they forgot about him.
Buzz should have know Kevin was missing.
I think Buzz is the true villain in this film. What do you think?

Or maybe his parents internally
 left Kevin home alone?
